chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan M. Weisbrod #00518916 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  AODA.  DNA sample.  

Court authorizes transfer of probation to Milwaukee County.

to Court from Dept of Corrections re: ct 3 in 15CF768

cc: State and PD's office

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 1:24 pm 
INCLUDES 17CF1049 AND 15CF768. 
State appears by ADA Davis Runde; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Paul Goetz. 
VRCW. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 17CF1049. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions def as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.

PLEA HEARING IN 17CF1049. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  

State moves to: 
Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property/Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 4 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 2 (Possess Firearm - Convicted of a Felony/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN 17CF1049 AND SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 15CF768. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 17CF1049: Ct. 1>>5 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 2 years ES - with 129 days sentence credit. 
                      : Ct. 2>>8 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 5 years ES - with 129 days sentence credit. 
In 15CF768: Ct. 1>>5 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 2 years ES - with 268 days sentence credit. 
                    : Ct. 3>>3.5 years imprisonment - 2 years IC & 1.5 years ES - with 268 days sentence credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES>>AODA and recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; 100 hours CS; CC including appropriate DNA surcharge (sample already on file); payment of outstanding costs from revocation file. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT. 
Atty Goetz requests issue re: def's eligibility for CIP and SAP be held open. 
COURT finds def eligible for CIP and SAP unless deemed otherwise by prison staff. 

Adj: 1:50 pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 4, 2018 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:18 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF656 AND 15CF768. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Pauline Toulouse.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF656: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF768: Ct. 2 (Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF768: Ct. 1 (Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def is entilted to 133 days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT authorizes transfer of probation to Milwaukee County.
